name: Fractured Oscar Nominees 2008 Quiz | Movie Fractures | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
No Country for Old Men.

	This is a Coen brothers film starring Tommy Lee Jones, Josh Brolin, and Javier Bardem as the pyscho killer. The movie won five Oscars including Best Picture, Best Director, and Best Supporting Actor (Bardem).

Marion Cotillard.

	Named Best Actress, she portrays French singer Edith Piaf in "La Vie en Rose." In my opinion, Cotillard does a brilliant job of showing how gifted, spirited, and pathetic Piaf was. The film won Best Makeup, too.

Viggo Mortensen.

	Nominated for Best Actor, he stars in "Eastern Promises," a violent film about the Russian mafia in England.

Ratatouille.

	Named Best Animated Feature, this film tells the tale of a French rat who happens to be a gifted chef. The movie is named for a country-style vegetable stew.

Ellen Page.

	Nominated for Best Actress, she stars in "Juno," a film about a pregnant teen who's putting her child up for adoption. The Academy nominated the movie for Best Picture, too. Diablo Cody, who wrote the script, won Best Original Screenplay for this film.

The Assassination of Jesse James.

	The full title is "The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford." Nominated for Best Cinematography, this film stars Brad Pitt and Casey Affleck, Ben's little brother. The title sums up the plot pretty well. Casey Affleck also starred in "Gone Baby Gone." In my opinion, he is a terrific young actor.

Daniel Day Lewis.

	Named Best Actor, he stars in "There Will Be Blood." At the Oscars he wore hoop earrings in both ears. I thought he looked fabulous.

Julie Christie.

	Nominated for Best Actress, she stars in "Away from Her," a film about an Alzheimer's sufferer and her husband.

There Will Be Blood.

	This film, the story of a ruthless oilman, received eight Oscar nominations, including Best Actor. Daniel Day-Lewis won the award.

Once.

	This independent film about two lonely musicians won Best Song for "Falling Slowly." Glen Hansard (of "The Commitments") and Marketa Irglova wrote this song. They also star in the film. In my opinion, it is a beautiful little movie--and a beautiful song, too.
